result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason E. BRICCO was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: under the Huber Law.    Transfer to Sheboygan County Jail is authorized or in the alternative travel outside the county for purposes of employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason E. BRICCO

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Battery (DVO) - No contest plea.   Convicted.    Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ten (10) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 07-22-16 by 5:00 p.m.   Court will authorize transfer to Sheboygan County Jail or in the alternative travel outside the court for purposes of employment.   
Defendant must submit DNA sample.   
$543.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 08-08-16 or 1 day jail.    $500.00 cash bail applied.    
Minutes.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with District Attorney set for 05-25-16 at 9:30 a.m.  Plea date set for 06-08-16 at 3:30 p.m.  The Court adds as a condition of bail that the defendant report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.   
Minutes.

RE:  Alecia Stolpa, on 03-05-16.
Initial appearance is set for 04-18-16 at 1:30 p.m.
$500.00 cash bail and bail bond furnished at time of arrest on 03-05-16 and delivered to Clerk of Court office by Sheriff's Department.
